intro: Myobroma lanuginosa, commonly known as the woolly myobroma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and showy, pinkish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
